channel.title: Fun Stuff on Stat 150 at Cal Poly
channel.description: Recent content in Fun Stuff on Stat 150 at Cal Poly

item.title: Cal Poly Pro Tip: Dining Hall tricks
item.description: Dietary Restrictions Having trouble with dietary restrictions on campus? Go to https://www.calpolydining.com/nutritioncalculator/ where you can see the nutrition information and calculator for each food service on campus. Simply filter by one of the restaurants and see it‚Äôs whole menu laid out in a way to show you what is vegetarian, vegan, gluten free, dairy free, and much more. This way you can see which restaurants or food options work best for your needs!

item.title: Quote of the Week: Outlier
item.description: Stat quote of the day: I'm not an outlier, I just haven't found my distribution yet!#statistician #outlier pic.twitter.com/uvtVG25KuD ‚Äî Amy Yang (@ayanalytics) May 1, 2019

item.title: Tweet of the Week: @jjaron
item.description: Unbelievable stat of the day: 90% of internet users don't know how to Ctrl+F https://t.co/hUJnmd5Mae ‚Äî Jacob Aron (@jjaron) November 19, 2019

item.title: Cal Poly Not-Pro Tip: Waffles
item.description: Are you wanting to save time doing your dreaded laundry? We‚Äôll be sure to check the WASH alert website to see if there are washer and dryers available or how much time is left on each machine! Search ‚Äúwashlaundry.com/calpoly‚Äù and select your building location!

item.title: Quote of the Week: Pearson
item.description: ‚ÄúStatistics is the grammar of science‚Äù - Karl Pearson

item.title: Tweet of the Week: @ruha9
item.description: I have now read @ruha9‚Äôs tour de force THRICE in the past two months, and you should, too! (Or once, at a minimum). ‚ÄúRace After Technology: Abolitionist Tools for the New Jim Code‚Äù https://t.co/AVYeNVRWyZ forever üñ§ @csdoctorsister for the recommendation pic.twitter.com/OC1BQY6sY3 ‚Äî Mara Averick (@dataandme) November 13, 2019

item.title: Cal Poly Not-Pro Tip: Waffles
item.description: At 805 Kitchen, to spice up your waffle, DO NOT grab toppings from the yogurt bar (chocolate chips, coconut flakes, etc) and add it into your waffle batter before cooking your waffle. There have been reports of severe allergic reactions where the ambulance has been required to come according to staff working there. If you want to up your waffle game, then please do it afterwards and simply add it to the finished waffle product.

item.title: Cal Poly Not-Pro Tip: Waffles

item.title: Cal Poly Pro Tip: Shortcut
item.description: In the UU Plaza and need to get to Baker? Cut straight through Building 52 (Science) which is right across from Lucy‚Äôs and Poly Deli! It saves a lot of walking time and eliminates the hills!

item.title: Quotes of the Week: Metaphors
item.description: ‚ÄúMost people use statistics the way a drunkard uses a lamp post: more for support than illumination‚Äù -Mark Twain ‚ÄúStatisticians, like artists, have the bad habit of falling in love with their models.‚Äù -George Box

item.title: Quote of the Week: Safe Stats
item.description: "We need to stop teaching abstinence-only statistics, telling students they can only do it if they are in a committed relationship with a statistician. But all their friends are out there doing statistics and having a great time. We need to teach safe stats." ‚Äï Hadley Wickham Source: https://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/mererenovation/17_Wickham.PDF

item.title: Tweets of the Week: @karim_douieb
item.description: Challenge accepted! Here is a transition between surface area of US counties and their associated population. This arguably provides a much more accurate reading of the situation. @observablehq notebook: https://t.co/wdfMeV5hO4 #HowChartsLie #DataViz #d3js https://t.co/lStHeeuMUw pic.twitter.com/MpYiXtsHmu ‚Äî Karim Dou√Øeb (@karim_douieb) October 8, 2019

item.title: Quote of the Week: Sherlock
item.description: ‚ÄúIt is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts.‚Äù ‚Äï Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Sherlock Holmes

item.title: Tweets of the Week: @NateSilver
item.description:
A few times a year, I get asked to be a judge of student statistical projects in politics or sports. While the students are very bright, they spend WAY too much time using fancy statistical methods and not enough time framing the right questions and contextualizing their answers.

‚Äî Nate Silver (@NateSilver538) October 6, 2019
